docs.title: John the Hype Man
docs.description: 英 Alright, folks, let's talk about John the Baptist, the original spiritual hype man. This guy was Jesus' warm-up act, the opening band before the main event.

docs.title: Virgin Mary Myth and Future of Reproduction
docs.description: Start writing here...

frontMatter.title: Virgin Mary Myth and Future of Reproduction

docs.title: Saint Peter Roast
docs.description: 英 You know, the tale of Saint Peter is a damn comedy gold mine. This guy was Jesus' main man, part of the holy entourage. But during the big trial, Pete pulls a disappearing act not once, not twice, but three times! Jesus must've been like, "Seriously, bro? We break bread together and this is how you do me?"

previous.title: Virgin Mary Myth and Future of Reproduction

docs.title: Bread Therapy Changing Lives of Seniors
docs.description: 英Welcome, folks! Today we've got a real treat - a guest who's mixing up research in a way that'll make you think twice about your kitchen.

frontMatter.title: Bread Therapy Changing Lives of Seniors

docs.title: Futuristic Japanese Curry
docs.description: 英 Folks, we're diving into some mind-blowing future cooking today.

next.title: Bread Therapy Changing Lives of Seniors

docs.title: Potato Memories
docs.description: 英 Alright, so your mom grew up on a potato farm in Idaho, huh? That's like the Siberia of the United States, am I right?

docs.title: The Ramen Empire Strikes Back
docs.description: 英 Before you go, one last question. What's the future of ramen? Are we talking flying noodles, teleporting broth?

docs.title: Sushi Nightmare
docs.description: 英 Alright, so picture this: I waddle into this sushi joint, right? It's like stepping into a morgue for fish. Neon signs flickering like dying heartbeats, chrome gleaming like freshly polished coffins - the whole morbid shebang.

next.title: The Shiretoko Sightseeing Boat Sinking Incident

docs.title: The Great Yakiniku Revolution
docs.description: 英So, we're talking about this plant-based revolution, right? People ditching steaks for salads. But here's what I'm wondering: what's gonna happen to traditional meat dishes like yakiniku in Japan?

previous.title: Bread Therapy Changing Lives of Seniors

docs.title: Franklin's Crazy Genius
docs.description: 英Ladies and gentlemen, let me tell you about this wild-eyed lunatic, this absolute madman, this…… founding father we call Ben Franklin.

docs.title: Kuriki's Everest Challenge
docs.description: 英 Let's talk about Takashi Kuriki - a guy who looked at Mount Everest and said, "You can take my fingers, but you can't take my dream!" Born in Hokkaido, he climbed the highest peaks on six continents. Just one shy of the seven summits club, and you know which one gave him trouble.

docs.title: Hakkoda's Deadly Snow Defeats Japanese Army
docs.description: 英 Welcome to the podcast, folks! Today, we've got an expert on military history joining us. They've got some wild stories about armies getting their asses kicked by Mother Nature. So, tell us about this crazy Japanese snow disaster.

frontMatter.title: Hakkoda's Deadly Snow Defeats Japanese Army

previous.title: The Shiretoko Sightseeing Boat Sinking Incident

docs.title: The Sewol Ferry Disaster
docs.description: 英 Folks, today we're diving into a maritime disaster that's more messed up than my first attempt at yoga. We've got a ship safety expert here to break it down.

previous.title: Hakkoda's Deadly Snow Defeats Japanese Army

docs.title: The Shiretoko Sightseeing Boat Sinking Incident
docs.description: 英 Alright, so let's talk about Hokkaido, Japan. You know, that place with the snow-capped mountains and pristine lakes? Well, apparently, it's also home to boats with a fucking death wish. Can you believe this shit?

frontMatter.title: The Shiretoko Sightseeing Boat Sinking Incident

next.title: Hakkoda's Deadly Snow Defeats Japanese Army

docs.title: Mars Colonization and Future Science
docs.description: 英Tonight my guest is a true comedy legend who's gonna give us his uniquely insightful and biting perspective on some cutting-edge science. Please welcome the one and only Guest!

docs.title: Mercury's Solar Roast
docs.description: 英 Hey there, space cadets! Today we're going to Mercury, the planet that's basically one giant tanning bed on steroids. Let's welcome our guest!

docs.title: Pluto
docs.description: 英 So, I'm reading this article about Pluto, right?

docs.title: Congratulations!
docs.description: You have just learned the basics of Docusaurus and made some changes to the initial template.

docs.title: Create a Blog Post
docs.description: Docusaurus creates a page for each blog post, but also a blog index page, a tag system, an RSS feed...

docs.title: Create a Document
docs.description: Documents are groups of pages connected through:

docs.title: Create a Page
docs.description: Add Markdown or React files to src/pages to create a standalone page:

docs.title: Deploy your site
docs.description: Docusaurus is a static-site-generator (also called Jamstack).

docs.title: Markdown Features
docs.description: Docusaurus supports Markdown and a few additional features.

docs.title: Manage Docs Versions
docs.description: Docusaurus can manage multiple versions of your docs.

docs.title: Translate your site
docs.description: Let's translate docs/intro.md to French.

default.title: Markdown page example
